trans-unit.source: Azure Redis Cache FAQ
trans-unit.target: Azure Redis Cache FAQ

trans-unit.source: Learn the answers to common questions, patterns and best practices for Azure Redis Cache
trans-unit.target: Learn the answers to common questions, patterns and best practices for Azure Redis Cache

trans-unit.source: Learn the answers to common questions, patterns and best practices for Azure Redis Cache.
trans-unit.target: Learn the answers to common questions, patterns and best practices for Azure Redis Cache.

trans-unit.source: Each Azure Redis Cache offering provides different levels of size, bandwidth, high availability and SLA options.
trans-unit.target: Each Azure Redis Cache offering provides different levels of size, bandwidth, high availability and SLA options.

trans-unit.source: Basic SKU - Single node, no replication or SLA, cache sizes from 250 MB up to 53 GB.
trans-unit.target: Basic SKU - Single node, no replication or SLA, cache sizes from 250 MB up to 53 GB.

trans-unit.source: Standard SKU - Primary/Secondary nodes with automatic replication, 99.9% SLA, cache sizes from 250 MB to 53 GB.
trans-unit.target: Standard SKU - Primary/Secondary nodes with automatic replication, 99.9% SLA, cache sizes from 250 MB to 53 GB.

trans-unit.source: If you desire high availability, choose the standard cache offering which has a 99.9% SLA.
trans-unit.target: If you desire high availability, choose the standard cache offering which has a 99.9% SLA.

trans-unit.source: For development and prototyping, or for scenarios where an SLA is not required, the basic offering could be appropriate.
trans-unit.target: For development and prototyping, or for scenarios where an SLA is not required, the basic offering could be appropriate.

trans-unit.source: The cache sizes and bandwidth map roughly to the sizes and bandwidth of the virtual machines that host the cache.
trans-unit.target: The cache sizes and bandwidth map roughly to the sizes and bandwidth of the virtual machines that host the cache.

trans-unit.source: The 250 MB sizes for both the basic and standard offerings are hosted on the Extra Small (A0) virtual machine size, which is hosted using shared cores, while the other sizes are hosted using dedicated cores.
trans-unit.target: The 250 MB sizes for both the basic and standard offerings are hosted on the Extra Small (A0) virtual machine size, which is hosted using shared cores, while the other sizes are hosted using dedicated cores.

trans-unit.source: The 1 GB cache sizes are hosted on the Small (A1) virtual machine size, which has 1 dedicated virtual core that is used to service both the operating system and the redis cache.
trans-unit.target: The 1 GB cache sizes are hosted on the Small (A1) virtual machine size, which has 1 dedicated virtual core that is used to service both the operating system and the redis cache.

trans-unit.source: Larger cache sizes are hosted on larger VM instances with multiple dedicated virtual cores.
trans-unit.target: Larger cache sizes are hosted on larger VM instances with multiple dedicated virtual cores.

trans-unit.source: If your cache has a high throughput, choose the 1 GB size or larger so that the cache is running using dedicated cores.
trans-unit.target: If your cache has a high throughput, choose the 1 GB size or larger so that the cache is running using dedicated cores.

trans-unit.source: The 1 GB cache size is hosted on a 1 core virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: The 1 GB cache size is hosted on a 1 core virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: This core is used to service both the OS and the cache.
trans-unit.target: This core is used to service both the OS and the cache.

trans-unit.source: Caches larger than 1 GB run on virtual machines with multiple cores, and the Redis cache uses a dedicated core that is not shared with the OS.
trans-unit.target: Caches larger than 1 GB run on virtual machines with multiple cores, and the Redis cache uses a dedicated core that is not shared with the OS.

trans-unit.source: Redis is single-threaded so having more than two cores does not provide additional benefit over having just two cores, but larger VM sizes typically have more bandwidth than smaller sizes.
trans-unit.target: Redis is single-threaded so having more than two cores does not provide additional benefit over having just two cores, but larger VM sizes typically have more bandwidth than smaller sizes.

trans-unit.source: If the cache server or client reaches the bandwidth limits, then you will receive timeouts on the client side.
trans-unit.target: If the cache server or client reaches the bandwidth limits, then you will receive timeouts on the client side.

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the maximum bandwidth values observed while testing various sizes of Azure Redis Cache using redis-benchmark.exe from an Iaas VM against the Azure Redis Cache endpoint.
trans-unit.target: The following table shows the maximum bandwidth values observed while testing various sizes of Azure Redis Cache using redis-benchmark.exe from an Iaas VM against the Azure Redis Cache endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Note that these values are not guaranteed and there is no SLA for these number, but should be typical.
trans-unit.target: Note that these values are not guaranteed and there is no SLA for these number, but should be typical.

trans-unit.source: You should load test your own application to determine the right cache size for your application.
trans-unit.target: You should load test your own application to determine the right cache size for your application.

trans-unit.target: Cache Name

trans-unit.source: For instructions on downloading the Redis tools such as redis-benchmark.exe, see the How can I run Redis commands? section.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on downloading the Redis tools such as redis-benchmark.exe, see the How can I run Redis commands? section.

trans-unit.source: For best performance and lowest latency, locate your Azure Redis Cache in the same region as your cache client application.
trans-unit.target: For best performance and lowest latency, locate your Azure Redis Cache in the same region as your cache client application.

trans-unit.source: Azure Redis Cache pricing is <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Azure Redis Cache pricing is <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The pricing page lists pricing as an hourly rate.
trans-unit.target: The pricing page lists pricing as an hourly rate.

trans-unit.source: Caches are billed on a per-minute basis from the time that the cache is created until the time that a cache is deleted.
trans-unit.target: Caches are billed on a per-minute basis from the time that the cache is created until the time that a cache is deleted.

trans-unit.source: There is no option for stopping or pausing the billing of a cache.
trans-unit.target: There is no option for stopping or pausing the billing of a cache.

trans-unit.source: Timeouts happen in the client that you use to talk to Redis.
trans-unit.target: Timeouts happen in the client that you use to talk to Redis.

trans-unit.source: For the most part Redis server does not time out.
trans-unit.target: For the most part Redis server does not time out.

trans-unit.source: When a command is sent to the Redis server, the command is queued up and Redis server eventually picks up the command and executes it.
trans-unit.target: When a command is sent to the Redis server, the command is queued up and Redis server eventually picks up the command and executes it.

trans-unit.source: However the client can time out during this process and if it does an exception is raised on the calling side.
trans-unit.target: However the client can time out during this process and if it does an exception is raised on the calling side.

trans-unit.source: For more information on troubleshooting timeout issues, see <linkText>Investigating timeout exceptions in StackExchange.Redis for Azure Redis Cache</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on troubleshooting timeout issues, see <linkText>Investigating timeout exceptions in StackExchange.Redis for Azure Redis Cache</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Redis Cache instances can be monitored in the <linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Redis Cache instances can be monitored in the <linkText>Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can view metrics, pin metrics charts to the Startboard, customize the date and time range of monitoring charts, add and remove metrics from the charts, and set alerts when certain conditions are met.
trans-unit.target: You can view metrics, pin metrics charts to the Startboard, customize the date and time range of monitoring charts, add and remove metrics from the charts, and set alerts when certain conditions are met.

trans-unit.source: These tools enable you to monitor the health of your Azure Redis Cache instances and help you manage your caching applications.
trans-unit.target: These tools enable you to monitor the health of your Azure Redis Cache instances and help you manage your caching applications.

trans-unit.source: For more information on monitoring your caches, see <linkText>Monitor Azure Redis Cache</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on monitoring your caches, see <linkText>Monitor Azure Redis Cache</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following are some common reason for a cache disconnect.
trans-unit.target: The following are some common reason for a cache disconnect.

trans-unit.source: Client-side causes
trans-unit.target: Client-side causes

trans-unit.source: The client application was redeployed.
trans-unit.target: The client application was redeployed.

trans-unit.source: The client application performed a scaling operation.
trans-unit.target: The client application performed a scaling operation.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Cloud Services or Web Apps, this may be due to auto-scaling.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Cloud Services or Web Apps, this may be due to auto-scaling.

trans-unit.source: The networking layer on the client side changed.
trans-unit.target: The networking layer on the client side changed.

trans-unit.source: Transient errors occurred in the client or in the network nodes between the client and the server.
trans-unit.target: Transient errors occurred in the client or in the network nodes between the client and the server.

trans-unit.source: The bandwidth threshold limits were reached.
trans-unit.target: The bandwidth threshold limits were reached.

trans-unit.source: CPU bound operations took too long to complete.
trans-unit.target: CPU bound operations took too long to complete.

trans-unit.source: Server-side causes
trans-unit.target: Server-side causes

trans-unit.source: On the standard cache offering, the Azure Redis Cache service initiated a fail-over from the primary node to the secondary node.
trans-unit.target: On the standard cache offering, the Azure Redis Cache service initiated a fail-over from the primary node to the secondary node.

trans-unit.source: Azure was patching the instance where the cache was deployed
trans-unit.target: Azure was patching the instance where the cache was deployed

trans-unit.source: This can be for Redis server updates or general VM maintenance.
trans-unit.target: This can be for Redis server updates or general VM maintenance.

trans-unit.source: StackExchange.Redis has many options.
trans-unit.target: StackExchange.Redis has many options.

trans-unit.source: This section talks about some of the common settings.
trans-unit.target: This section talks about some of the common settings.

trans-unit.source: For more detailed information about StackExchange.Redis options, see <linkText>StackExchange.Redis configuration</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more detailed information about StackExchange.Redis options, see <linkText>StackExchange.Redis configuration</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: ConfigurationOptions
trans-unit.target: ConfigurationOptions

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Recommendation
trans-unit.target: Recommendation

trans-unit.source: AbortOnConnectFail
trans-unit.target: AbortOnConnectFail

trans-unit.source: When set to true, the connection will not reconnect after a network failure.
trans-unit.target: When set to true, the connection will not reconnect after a network failure.

trans-unit.source: Set to false and let StackExchange.Redis reconnect automatically.
trans-unit.target: Set to false and let StackExchange.Redis reconnect automatically.

trans-unit.source: ConnectRetry
trans-unit.target: ConnectRetry

trans-unit.source: The number of times to repeat connection attempts during initial connect.
trans-unit.target: The number of times to repeat connection attempts during initial connect.

trans-unit.source: ConnectTimeout
trans-unit.target: ConnectTimeout

trans-unit.source: Timeout in ms for connect operations.
trans-unit.target: Timeout in ms for connect operations.

trans-unit.source: In most cases the default values of the client are sufficient.
trans-unit.target: In most cases the default values of the client are sufficient.

trans-unit.source: You can fine tune the options based on your workload.
trans-unit.target: You can fine tune the options based on your workload.

trans-unit.source: Retries
trans-unit.target: Retries

trans-unit.source: For ConnectRetry and ConnectTimeout the general guidance is to fail fast and retry again.
trans-unit.target: For ConnectRetry and ConnectTimeout the general guidance is to fail fast and retry again.

trans-unit.source: This is based on your workload and how much time on average it takes for your client to issue a Redis command and receive a response.
trans-unit.target: This is based on your workload and how much time on average it takes for your client to issue a Redis command and receive a response.

trans-unit.source: Let StackExchange.Redis automatically reconnect instead of checking connection status and reconnecting yourself.
trans-unit.target: Let StackExchange.Redis automatically reconnect instead of checking connection status and reconnecting yourself.

trans-unit.source: Avoid using the ConnectionMultiplexer.IsConnected property.
trans-unit.target: Avoid using the ConnectionMultiplexer.IsConnected property.

trans-unit.source: Snowballing - sometimes you may run into an issue where you are retrying and this snowballs and never recovers. In this case you should consider using an exponential backoff retry algorithm as described in <linkText>Retry general guidance</linkText><title></title> published by the Microsoft Patterns & Practices group.
trans-unit.target: Snowballing - sometimes you may run into an issue where you are retrying and this snowballs and never recovers. In this case you should consider using an exponential backoff retry algorithm as described in <linkText>Retry general guidance</linkText><title></title> published by the Microsoft Patterns & Practices group.

trans-unit.source: Timeout values
trans-unit.target: Timeout values

trans-unit.source: Consider your workload and set the values accordingly.
trans-unit.target: Consider your workload and set the values accordingly.

trans-unit.source: If you are storing large values, set the timeout to a higher value.
trans-unit.target: If you are storing large values, set the timeout to a higher value.

trans-unit.source: Set ABortOnConnectFail to false and let StackExchange.Redis reconnect for you.
trans-unit.target: Set ABortOnConnectFail to false and let StackExchange.Redis reconnect for you.

trans-unit.source: Use a single ConnectionMultiplexer instance for the application.
trans-unit.target: Use a single ConnectionMultiplexer instance for the application.

trans-unit.source: You can use a LazyConnection to create a single instance that is returned by a Connection property, as shown in <linkText>Connect to the cache using the ConnectionMultiplexer class</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can use a LazyConnection to create a single instance that is returned by a Connection property, as shown in <linkText>Connect to the cache using the ConnectionMultiplexer class</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Set the ConnectionMultiplexer.ClientName property to an app instance unique name for diagnostic purposes.
trans-unit.target: Set the ConnectionMultiplexer.ClientName property to an app instance unique name for diagnostic purposes.

trans-unit.source: Use multiple ConnectionMultiplexer instances for custom workloads.
trans-unit.target: Use multiple ConnectionMultiplexer instances for custom workloads.

trans-unit.source: You can follow this model if you have varying load in your application.
trans-unit.target: You can follow this model if you have varying load in your application.

trans-unit.source: For example:
trans-unit.target: For example:

trans-unit.source: You can have one multiplexer for dealing with large keys.
trans-unit.target: You can have one multiplexer for dealing with large keys.

trans-unit.source: You can have one multiplexer for dealing with small keys.
trans-unit.target: You can have one multiplexer for dealing with small keys.

trans-unit.source: You can set different values for connection timeouts and retry logic for each ConnectionMultiplexer that you use.
trans-unit.target: You can set different values for connection timeouts and retry logic for each ConnectionMultiplexer that you use.

trans-unit.source: Set the ClientName property on each multiplexer to help with diagnostics.
trans-unit.target: Set the ClientName property on each multiplexer to help with diagnostics.

trans-unit.source: This will lead to more streamlined latency per ConnectionMultiplexer.
trans-unit.target: This will lead to more streamlined latency per ConnectionMultiplexer.

trans-unit.source: You should not run certain Redis commands which take a long time to complete without understanding the impact of these commands.
trans-unit.target: You should not run certain Redis commands which take a long time to complete without understanding the impact of these commands.

trans-unit.source: For example, do not run the <linkText>KEYS</linkText><title></title> command in production as it could take a long time to return depending on the number of keys.
trans-unit.target: For example, do not run the <linkText>KEYS</linkText><title></title> command in production as it could take a long time to return depending on the number of keys.

trans-unit.source: Redis is a single-threaded server and it processes commands one at a time.
trans-unit.target: Redis is a single-threaded server and it processes commands one at a time.

trans-unit.source: If you have other commands issued after KEYS, they will not be processed until Redis processes the KEYS command.
trans-unit.target: If you have other commands issued after KEYS, they will not be processed until Redis processes the KEYS command.

trans-unit.source: Key sizes - should I use small key/values or large key/values?
trans-unit.target: Key sizes - should I use small key/values or large key/values?

trans-unit.source: In general it depends on the scenario.
trans-unit.target: In general it depends on the scenario.

trans-unit.source: If your scenario requires larger keys then you can adjust the ConnectionTimeout and retry values and adjust your retry logic.
trans-unit.target: If your scenario requires larger keys then you can adjust the ConnectionTimeout and retry values and adjust your retry logic.

trans-unit.source: From a Redis server perspective, smaller values are observed to have better performance.
trans-unit.target: From a Redis server perspective, smaller values are observed to have better performance.

trans-unit.source: This does not mean that you can't store larger values in Redis; you must be aware of the following considerations.
trans-unit.target: This does not mean that you can't store larger values in Redis; you must be aware of the following considerations.

trans-unit.source: Latencies will be higher.
trans-unit.target: Latencies will be higher.

trans-unit.source: If you have one set of data that is larger and one that is smaller, you can use multiple ConnectionMultiplexer instances, each configured with a different set of timeout and retry values, as described in the previous <linkText>What do the StackExchange.Redis configuration options do</linkText><title></title> section.
trans-unit.target: If you have one set of data that is larger and one that is smaller, you can use multiple ConnectionMultiplexer instances, each configured with a different set of timeout and retry values, as described in the previous <linkText>What do the StackExchange.Redis configuration options do</linkText><title></title> section.

trans-unit.source: Redis server does not support SSL out of the box, but Azure Redis Cache does.
trans-unit.target: Redis server does not support SSL out of the box, but Azure Redis Cache does.

trans-unit.source: If you are connecting to Azure Redis Cache and your client supports SSL, like StackExchange.Redis, then you should use SSL.
trans-unit.target: If you are connecting to Azure Redis Cache and your client supports SSL, like StackExchange.Redis, then you should use SSL.

trans-unit.source: Note that the non-SSL port is disabled by default for new Azure Redis Cache instances.
trans-unit.target: Note that the non-SSL port is disabled by default for new Azure Redis Cache instances.

trans-unit.source: If your client does not support SSL, then you must enable the non-SSL port by following the directions in the <linkText>Access ports</linkText><title></title> section of the <linkText>Configure a cache in Azure Redis Cache</linkText><title></title> article.
trans-unit.target: If your client does not support SSL, then you must enable the non-SSL port by following the directions in the <linkText>Access ports</linkText><title></title> section of the <linkText>Configure a cache in Azure Redis Cache</linkText><title></title> article.

trans-unit.source: Redis tools such as redis-cli do not work with the SSL port, but you can use a utility such as stunnel to securely connect the tools to the SSL port by following the directions in the Announcing ASP.NET Session State Provider for Redis Preview Release blog post.
trans-unit.target: Redis tools such as redis-cli do not work with the SSL port, but you can use a utility such as stunnel to securely connect the tools to the SSL port by following the directions in the Announcing ASP.NET Session State Provider for Redis Preview Release blog post.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on downloading the Redis tools, see the <linkText>How can I run Redis commands?</linkText><title></title> section.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on downloading the Redis tools, see the <linkText>How can I run Redis commands?</linkText><title></title> section.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Enable cache diagnostics</linkText><title></title> so you can <linkText>monitor</linkText><title></title> the health of your cache.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Enable cache diagnostics</linkText><title></title> so you can <linkText>monitor</linkText><title></title> the health of your cache.

trans-unit.source: You can view the metrics in the preview portal and you can also <linkText>download and review</linkText><title></title> them using the tools of your choice.
trans-unit.target: You can view the metrics in the preview portal and you can also <linkText>download and review</linkText><title></title> them using the tools of your choice.

trans-unit.source: You can use redis-benchmark.exe to load test your Redis server.
trans-unit.target: You can use redis-benchmark.exe to load test your Redis server.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the load testing client and the Redis cache are in the same region.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the load testing client and the Redis cache are in the same region.

trans-unit.source: Use redis-cli.exe and monitor the cache using the INFO command.
trans-unit.target: Use redis-cli.exe and monitor the cache using the INFO command.

trans-unit.source: If your load is causing high memory fragmentation then you should scale up to a larger cache size.
trans-unit.target: If your load is causing high memory fragmentation then you should scale up to a larger cache size.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on downloading the Redis tools, see the <linkText>How can I run Redis commands?</linkText><title></title> section.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on downloading the Redis tools, see the <linkText>How can I run Redis commands?</linkText><title></title> section.

trans-unit.source: You can use any of the commands listed at <linkText>Redis commands</linkText><title></title> except for the commands listed at <linkText>Redis commands not supported in Azure Redis Cache</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: You can use any of the commands listed at <linkText>Redis commands</linkText><title></title> except for the commands listed at <linkText>Redis commands not supported in Azure Redis Cache</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: To run Redis commands you have several options.
trans-unit.target: To run Redis commands you have several options.

trans-unit.source: If you have a Standard cache, you can run Redis commands using the <linkText>Redis Console</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: If you have a Standard cache, you can run Redis commands using the <linkText>Redis Console</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This provides a secure way to run Redis commands in the preview portal.
trans-unit.target: This provides a secure way to run Redis commands in the preview portal.

trans-unit.source: You can also use the Redis command line tools.
trans-unit.target: You can also use the Redis command line tools.

trans-unit.source: To use them, perform the following steps.
trans-unit.target: To use them, perform the following steps.

trans-unit.source: Download the <linkText>Redis command line tools</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Download the <linkText>Redis command line tools</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Connect to the cache using redis-cli.exe.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the cache using redis-cli.exe.

trans-unit.source: Pass in the cache endpoint using the -h switch and the key using -a as shown in the following example.
trans-unit.target: Pass in the cache endpoint using the -h switch and the key using -a as shown in the following example.

trans-unit.source: redis-cli -h .redis.cache.windows.net -a
trans-unit.target: redis-cli -h .redis.cache.windows.net -a

trans-unit.source: Note that the Redis command line tools do not work with the SSL port, but you can use a utility such as stunnel to securely connect the tools to the SSL port by following the directions in the Announcing ASP.NET Session State Provider for Redis Preview Release blog post.
trans-unit.target: Note that the Redis command line tools do not work with the SSL port, but you can use a utility such as stunnel to securely connect the tools to the SSL port by following the directions in the Announcing ASP.NET Session State Provider for Redis Preview Release blog post.

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Patterns & Practices has the following guidance.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Patterns & Practices has the following guidance.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Caching guidance</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Caching guidance</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Cloud Application Design and Implementation Guidance</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Cloud Application Design and Implementation Guidance</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Common cache patterns with Azure Redis Cache</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Common cache patterns with Azure Redis Cache</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Microsoft Azure Redis Cache is based on the popular open source Redis Cache, giving you access to a secure, dedicated Redis cache, managed by Microsoft.
trans-unit.target: Microsoft Azure Redis Cache is based on the popular open source Redis Cache, giving you access to a secure, dedicated Redis cache, managed by Microsoft.

trans-unit.source: A variety of <linkText>Redis clients</linkText><title></title> are available for many programming languages.
trans-unit.target: A variety of <linkText>Redis clients</linkText><title></title> are available for many programming languages.

trans-unit.source: Each client has its own API that makes calls to the Redis cache instance using <linkText>Redis commands</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Each client has its own API that makes calls to the Redis cache instance using <linkText>Redis commands</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Because each client is different, there is not one centralized class reference on MSDN; instead each client maintains its own reference documentation.
trans-unit.target: Because each client is different, there is not one centralized class reference on MSDN; instead each client maintains its own reference documentation.

trans-unit.source: In addition to the reference documentation, there are several tutorials on Azure.com showing how to get started with Azure Redis Cache using different languages and cache clients on the <linkText>Redis Cache documentation</linkText><title></title> page.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the reference documentation, there are several tutorials on Azure.com showing how to get started with Azure Redis Cache using different languages and cache clients on the <linkText>Redis Cache documentation</linkText><title></title> page.
